definition: practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Rachel watches Ben while Ross has a meeting, and she teaches him all about practical jokes.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯开会，瑞秋替他照看儿子班并教他恶作剧。

sentences.english: Who is it. Suspect is a practical joke, she gives a reply.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”疑是恶作剧，她淡淡地回了一句。

sentences.english: Enough is enough they say - it's time to fight back.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为恶作剧的时间已经够了，现在是时候回击了。

sentences.english: You may laugh at a prank on April Fools' Day.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会因为愚人节的一个恶作剧而发笑。

sentences.english: The boy has a shortcoming, which is telling lies and playing tricks on others.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子有一个坏毛病，就是喜欢说谎，爱搞恶作剧。

sentences.english: All you have to do is simply switch the salt shaker with sugar!
sentences.chinese: 在这个恶作剧里，你所做的仅仅是把盐罐换成糖罐。

sentences.english: They probably are. Mischief is what they like best.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能真的在恶作剧，因为那是他们最喜欢的。

sentences.english: I broke my nose as a child - it was something with some wild pranks, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我小时候弄断过我的鼻子，就是一些小孩子的恶作剧。

sentences.english: You’ve been a good sport to laugh at the trick we played on you.
sentences.chinese: 你真是个有雅量的人，对我们的恶作剧一笑置之。

sentences.english: The colleagues made Li Pen the victim of the practical joke very embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 同事弄得李萍，那个恶作剧的受害者，非常尴尬。

sentences.english: His wicked trick is to get the kids to kick bricks and lick the cricket ticket.
sentences.chinese: 他的缺德恶作剧是让孩子们踢砖和舔板球门。

sentences.english: Then they became less skeptical. His diagnosis on the baby next door did the trick.
sentences.chinese: 而他对隔壁邻居家婴孩的诊断看起来更像是恶作剧了。

sentences.english: Some of these hoaxes will be put together into a pseudo-haiku news conference.
sentences.chinese: 一些恶作剧者将这些俳句拼凑成一个伪新闻发布会。

sentences.english: I don't mind a practical joke within limits but this is going too far.
sentences.chinese: 我不反对适度的恶作剧，可是这未免太过分了。

sentences.english: The capriccio that I make be regarded as most.
sentences.chinese: 我搞的恶作剧算是最多的了。

definition: to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
